column5: bill I hope you get the action next week I had today.100 crappies on the clicker then I gave up.lol,add 50 plus walleyes to.none stop.drop shot did the trick.they were reluctent to take a jig and they walleyes jumped on it to.5c this morning.cool ride from clarkes.
Good catch! Makes the thumb kinda sore, though. A good kind of sore!! I better bring along some extra band-aids! Bill
My thumb is fine.but I would suggest some extra clothing for sure.lol.

Wishing I was fishing there too! Our trip there is always spring. Next spring will be the week after the opener. I’m sure there’s better lakes but we love it and the folks at Clark’s. Couldn’t get on crappie this year but we slayed them last year. Good luck and have fun!
Anything happening at Cedar Lake? One more week til crappie Nirvana. Bill

Bill bite is on.been on cedar all week.walleyes and crappies have been good. 20-25 ft.they don't go back you have to squeeze them and make them burp.but there all keeper size.consistent 12-14".awesome slabs.about any method works to get them.been tough conditions on the lake.winds from all directions and been 40 km most days.today calmer but got chased of lake by lightning.came back in afternoon and it wasn't to bad.some rain.good luck.where are you staying.
heres some pics to get you going bill
Nice pictures, John! We have a crew of 9 coming up, staying at the large middle cabin at Cedar Point. Stop in if you get the chance! Bill

I'll try during week.took my guest there yesterday for a truck ride after the lightning kicked us off the lake.lol.kathy let us try her left over meatloaf.fish bit good in afternoon when we hit the lake.good luck next week.last today.my trim/tilt went out so will have to see what went.

See ya there Bill. We met at the sports show at the dome this spring. I do the show for the camp. Going to need some pointers as i have never fall fished Cedar. Early june guy here looking for some fall experience to relay to the show guests! I will be in cabin 1. See ya next week!

Great day on Cedar Lake today out of Clarkes Northern Lights Resort.Could not have asked for a nicer fall day.Cool start so I went a little later but was peeling clothes of pretty quick as the day went on.Mainly went for muskie as I needed a casting fix having done a lot of walleye fishing lately.Muskies did not cooperate.to clear out and maybe to calm.Walleye fishing though was fantastic.Some of the muskie spots I fished had loads of walleyes of the rock piles and will try those spots tomorrow as iam headed to the east end of the lake for crappies.water temps today climbed a bit from last week at 66 f.Walleyes all over the depths fairly shallow to 30 ft.Tried my best with the selfie .
